page.title: 03LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Arnside Knott { Arnside Knott is the most prominent hill in the area. It rises to 159m. above sea level and affords magnificent views of the{Lake District {Fells}to the north, the{Pennines}to the east, of the Lancashire coast to the south and Morecambe Bay to the west. The land belongs to the National Trust and this organization has arranged nature trails so that visitors and naturalists can observe the wildlife, the birds, mammals, reptiles, insects, flowers ferns and trees which flourish there. On the summit of the Knott there is a toposcope, an indicator giving details of the distant hills which can been seen.
